intro: Nidorella stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Nidorella stricta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
